thread.title: Stormy Conditions, Mountain Snow To Hit California; Slow Travel Likely on Weekend | Nature World News
thread.title_full: Stormy Conditions, Mountain Snow To Hit California; Slow Travel Likely on Weekend | Nature World News

author: Kenneth John
title: Stormy Conditions, Mountain Snow To Hit California; Slow Travel Likely on Weekend | Nature World News
text: Slower commutes and travel concerns are likely in portions of California due to the stormy outlook and mountain snow in the region. The late-week storm can impact the much-awaited travel. California has experienced prolonged drought and raging wildfires due to the dry vegetation and strong winds. The [stormy conditions](https://www.natureworldnews.com/articles/60062/20231228/nws-weather-forecast-heavy-rain-hit-new-england-mid-atlantic.htm) will help provide relief in California and the Western US. In the Pacific Northwest, recent reports showed the rounds of rain that caused more travel concerns due to the freezing outlook and snow. Flooding concerns were also reported due to heavy rain and snowmelt. The [National Weather Service ](https://www.wpc.ncep.noaa.gov/discussions/hpcdiscussions.php?disc=pmdspd)(NWS) reported that an anomalous weather pattern is also expected this weekend. Residents can notice milder temperatures in the northern and western portions of the US. From the Northern Plains to the Northeast, people can expect a warmer weather outlook, with overnight temperatures reaching more than 20 degrees above normal. Stormy Conditions, Mountain Snow in California According to the [recent forecasts](https://www.accuweather.com/en/weather-news/late-week-storm-to-end-californias-dry-stretch-bring-travel-disrupting-rain-snow/1607218), rounds of rain can unfold in parts of San Francisco and Los Angeles as cold air begins this winter. In the late week, the rain is also expected in the following areas: - San Diego - Los Angeles - Fresno - San Francisco - Reno - Redding - California's Central Coast - Sacramento Valley In the higher elevations or Sierra Nevada, people can expect potential snow and precipitation on the weekend. Meanwhile, a dry weather outlook will be likely in Denver and El Paso. Chilly outlook will also unleash in Minneapolis, Chicago and Kansas City. In [Kansas City](https://twitter.com/NWSKansasCity/status/1740126547674296522), light snow is also likely in the region, including in portions of Central Missouri. Residents should anticipate intermittent snow. Potential slightly warmer temperatures can reach in the upper 30s to lower 40s. The snow in California or Sierra Nevada will become helpful in drought conditions or summer in the region when water levels can become very low due to drought. Also Read: [NWS Weather Forecast: Heavy Rain to Hit New England, Mid-Atlantic This Week](https://www.natureworldnews.com/articles/60062/20231228/nws-weather-forecast-heavy-rain-hit-new-england-mid-atlantic.htm) Weather Forecast in Other Parts of the US: Wintry Weather Outlook In the [latest forecast](https://www.natureworldnews.com/articles/60061/20231228/south-weather-forecast-wintry-first-snowflakes-before-2023-ends.htm), chilly weather outlook will be likely in the Plains and [Wyoming](https://www.weather.gov/wwamap/wwatxtget.php?cwa=gjt&wwa=all). The cooler conditions will ease the dry and hotter weather in the US. A freezing rain outlook can impact portions of the South this weekend. Americans should be extra careful in driving due to slower commutes and slippery roads. Moreover, motorists should prepare their vehicles before traveling this week this upcoming holiday. Emergency kits inside vehicles are recommended to avoid road hassles. If the weather doesn't improve, staying at home is advisable, or wait until the weather conditions become better.
